bibl.title: Fasce di lana in un papiro latino (P.Masada 723 riedito)
bibl.seg: Andrea Bernini, Fasce di lana in un papiro latino (P.Masada 723 riedito).

P. Masada 723 (= Ch.L.A. XLVI, 1366) is an important source on medical practice within the Roman army. A revision of the text shows the use of woollen bandages for the wounded, and gives us a better understanding of the section referring to the sick. A palaeographical reconsideration of the document proves it to be an example of duplex manus, the phenomenon by which different graphical levels correspond to different textual sections.
bibl.note: P. Masada 723 (= Ch.L.A. XLVI, 1366) is an important source on medical practice within the Roman army.
